availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Chambers Brent (Bourbon County, Kentucky, bank teller, soldier, and sheriff)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, bank teller, soldier, and sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Nicole Ford Brent. Bank teller in Paris, Kentucky, in 1860. First lieutenant in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment from August 1862 to February 1863.. Major in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment from February 1863 to August 1863. Sheriff of Boubon County, Kentucky, in 1864.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Paris, p. 7. Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0095. "A Banker's Death," The Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), May 29, 1892, p. 9. Find A Grave, "John Chambers Brent (1836-1892)," Memorial #110537069, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/110537069/john-chambers-brent (accessed January 29, 2017).
